creator: mcsi@mcsi.pp.ru
text:
Here's the part of script log. The script failed with 500 error code, however as
you can see, all needed headers are presented. The script takes several minutes
to complete and in 15-20% approx. fails with such an error.
Can anyone sched some light on this?

%% [Thu Sep 29 22:05:35 2005] POST /cgi-bin/my/firm.cgi?a_datafeed_form=1 HTTP/1.1
%% 500 /usr/local/www/data/knet/cgi-bin/my/firm.cgi
%request
Host: knet.domain
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; FreeBSD i386; en-US; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20050929
Accept:
text/xml,application/xml,application/xhtml+xml,text/html;q=0.9,text/plain;q=0.8,image/png,*/*;q=0.5
Accept-Language: ru,en-us;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
Accept-Charset: KOI8-R,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.7
Keep-Alive: 300
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://knet.domain/my/datafeed/
Cookie: uid=8; CGISESSID=4dcd05b3d247c81cca37e06aab4ac05b; limit=10
Authorization: Basic bWNzaTpwb3BwYTE=
Content-Type: multipart/form-data;
boundary=---------------------------1807130337578354438892053144
Content-Length: 407761

-----------------------------1807130337578354438892053144

Content-Disposition: form-data; name="datafeed_class"

creator: apachebugs.wildyam.kerfloogle@neverbox.com
text:
Created attachment 16991
Simplest test cases

Either of the attached scripts (one perl, one bash) will intermittently invoke
the referenced bug in Apache/2.0.54 on Debian GNU/Linux testing ("etch")
running a kernel version 2.4.22 with:

solomon:/etc/apache2# apache2 -V
Server version: Apache/2.0.54
Server built:	Sep  5 2005 11:15:09
Server's Module Magic Number: 20020903:9
Architecture:	32-bit
Server compiled with....
 -D APACHE_MPM_DIR="server/mpm/prefork"
 -D APR_HAS_SENDFILE
 -D APR_HAS_MMAP
 -D APR_HAVE_IPV6 (IPv4-mapped addresses enabled)
 -D APR_USE_SYSVSEM_SERIALIZE
 -D APR_USE_PTHREAD_SERIALIZE
 -D SINGLE_LISTEN_UNSERIALIZED_ACCEPT
 -D APR_HAS_OTHER_CHILD
 -D AP_HAVE_RELIABLE_PIPED_LOGS
 -D HTTPD_ROOT=""
 -D SUEXEC_BIN="/usr/lib/apache2/suexec2"
 -D DEFAULT_PIDLOG="/var/run/httpd.pid"
 -D DEFAULT_SCOREBOARD="logs/apache_runtime_status"
 -D DEFAULT_LOCKFILE="/var/run/accept.lock"
 -D DEFAULT_ERRORLOG="logs/error_log"
 -D AP_TYPES_CONFIG_FILE="/etc/apache2/mime.types"
 -D SERVER_CONFIG_FILE="/etc/apache2/apache2.conf"
Was anything logged to the error_log?
creator: jorton@redhat.com
